subject: Nutrition
title: Raw Food Is Always Better
description: A fast breakdown of Raw Food Is Always Better for builders.

hook.text: Raw food devotees claim cooking destroys nutrition. The truth is more complicated than that.

buildup.text: Cooking does reduce some water-soluble vitamins like C and certain B vitamins in vegetables.

discovery.text: But cooking also breaks down cell walls, releasing nutrients your body can't access from raw food.

twist.text: Cooked tomatoes have three times more lycopene. Cooked carrots deliver more beta-carotene than raw.

climax.text: A mix of raw and cooked foods gives you the broadest range of bioavailable nutrients.

punchline.text: Some nutrients need heat to become available.
